description:
This re-organizes the Chombo frontend. There is now a generic Chombo reader from which other frontends, like Orion, can subclass. This also adds support for lower dimensional Chombo datasets, and for Chombo datasets that contain particles. 

This has been tested with Orion data and with a variety of general Chombo example outputs. I did not touch the Pluto frontend, since I don't have a means for testing whether I'm messing it up or not.
title: Chombo frontend Refactor

content.raw: Something went wrong, you should checkout http://tests.yt-project.org/job/py2.7-yt-3.0_testing/539/
content.html: Something went wrong, you should checkout http://tests.yt-project.org/job/py2.7-yt-3.0_testing/539/

content.raw: All tests pass. Good job!
content.html: All tests pass. Good job!

content.raw: Hi @atmyers this is awesome -- I'm going to review it, but I'm really quite grateful you've put this all together.
content.html: Hi Andrew Myers this is awesome -- I'm going to review it, but I'm really quite grateful you've put this all together.

content.raw: I wonder, do we still need the `orion2enzoDict` or `parameterDict` objects?
content.html: I wonder, do we still need the orion2enzoDict or parameterDict objects?

content.raw: You can just use `any` here, not `np.any`.
content.html: You can just use any here, not np.any.

content.raw: Does this mean that it has to be executed from within the directory of the `pluto.ini` and `orion2.ini` files?  Could you add something on the outer scope that does something like check if `args[0]` is a string, then if it is, get `os.path.dirname(os.path.fullpath(args[0]))`, then `os.path.join(that, "pluto.ini")`?
content.html: Does this mean that it has to be executed from within the directory of the pluto.ini and orion2.ini files? Could you add something on the outer scope that does something like check if args[0] is a string, then if it is, get os.path.dirname(os.path.fullpath(args[0])), then os.path.join(that, "pluto.ini")?

content.raw: Minor comments, but looks great.
content.html: Minor comments, but looks great.

content.raw: These are basically used to add "Gamma" and "RefineBy" to the ds.parameters dictionary. As far as I can tell from grep, these are no longer used anywhere, but I'm not 100% certain. At any rate, they shouldn't be needed, since they are redundant with ds.gamma and ds.refine_by. I think it would be fine to remove them.
content.html: These are basically used to add "Gamma" and "RefineBy" to the ds.parameters dictionary. As far as I can tell from grep, these are no longer used anywhere, but I'm not 100% certain. At any rate, they shouldn't be needed, since they are redundant with ds.gamma and ds.refine_by. I think it would be fine to remove them.

content.raw: Hi Matthew Turk - thanks for reviewing. I've addressed your comments below, but before we accept I should probably fix the issue I reported to the yt-dev earlier today.
content.html: Hi Matthew Turk - thanks for reviewing. I've addressed your comments below, but before we accept I should probably fix the issue I reported to the yt-dev earlier today.

content.raw: Does the removal of this code mean that users won't be able to query for runtime parameters anymore?
content.html: Does the removal of this code mean that users won't be able to query for runtime parameters anymore?

content.raw: All tests pass. Good job!
content.html: All tests pass. Good job!

content.raw: There will still be a dictionary of parameters, it just won't contain gamma or the refinement ratio. Those were redundant with ds.gamma and ds.refine_by, anyway, but maybe some people's scripts will look for those in ds.parameters? I don't have a strong opinion about this either way...
content.html: There will still be a dictionary of parameters, it just won't contain gamma or the refinement ratio. Those were redundant with ds.gamma and ds.refine_by, anyway, but maybe some people's scripts will look for those in ds.parameters? I don't have a strong opinion about this either way...

content.raw: Oh, sorry, I was misreading this and thought that this would kill `ds.parameters` entirely.
content.html: Oh, sorry, I was misreading this and thought that this would kill ds.parameters entirely.

content.raw: FWIW, I found the issue - the child masks were not getting read in correctly in 3.0. This should be fixed now.
content.html: FWIW, I found the issue - the child masks were not getting read in correctly in 3.0. This should be fixed now.

content.html: Something went wrong, you should checkout http://tests.yt-project.org/job/py2.7-yt-3.0_testing/569/

content.raw: Uh, I'm not really sure why there are conflicts here. Is there a way to just make it accept my version?
content.html: Uh, I'm not really sure why there are conflicts here. Is there a way to just make it accept my version?

content.raw:
I think you just need to merge with development on yt_analysis/yt:

```
hg pull -B experimental https://bitbucket.org/yt_analysis/yt
hg merge experimental
hg commit -m "Merging with mainline"
hg push -B experimental https://bitbucket.org/yt_analysis/yt
```

And then update the PR.
content.html:
I think you just need to merge with development on yt_analysis/yt:

hg pull -B experimental https://bitbucket.org/yt_analysis/yt

hg commit -m "Merging with mainline"
hg push -B experimental https://bitbucket.org/yt_analysis/yt

And then update the PR.
